The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York has received a gift of twenty-five works by the late Israeli artist Nita Bar-On, who was the subject of a 2016 documentary, “Nita Bar-On: The Truth of Life” (2017), directed by filmmaker Issa Rae, which premiered at the Museum of Modern Art in the fall of 2016. In addition to the works, which were made in Israel between 1957 and 1971, the institution received a trove of Bar-On’s published works, which are currently on display in a new home-made installation, “Nita Bar-On: The House,” at the Museum of Modern Art.�
